channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Dozens killed in flooding caused by rainfall 'not seen in 100 years' in Europe
item.description: At least 46 people have died due to severe flooding in western Europe, caused by what experts described as the heaviest rainfall in a century.

item.title: Video shows widespread damage from catastrophic floods
item.description: Flooding in Germany, Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg has caused devastation and claimed at least 40 lives in Germany and six in Belgium.

item.title: How America's top general found himself caught up in Trump's political wars
Merkel's meeting with Biden marks final goodbye to Washington
item.description: President Joe Biden and German Chancellor Angela Merkel are set to meet in Washington on Thursday in what is likely the European leader's final appearance at the White House before she steps down from her long-held position this fall.

item.title: See cities in South Africa left gutted after unprecedented violence and looting
item.description: CNN's David McKenzie reports from Soweto, South Africa, on the devastating aftereffects of looting and protests that took place in parts of the country. Protests erupted last week as former South African President Jacob Zuma, 79, turned himself in to authorities to serve a 15-month jail term for contempt of court. At least 72 have died in some of the worst violence the country has seen in years.

item.title: US sues Amazon for selling dangerous products
item.description: The US Consumer Product Safety Commission says Amazon is selling hazardous products to its customers. The federal safety watchdog is suing Amazon to stop.

item.title: Asia's new Covid-19 epicenter
item.description: Indonesia reported 54,517 new cases of Covid-19, authorities said Wednesday, a single-day national record and dire warning sign for the world's fourth-most populous country.

item.title: Delta variant surges in Middle East and North Africa as region braces for 'catastrophic consequences'
item.description: The Middle East and North Africa is witnessing a surge in Covid-19 cases aggravated by the Delta variant of the virus -- and it may get worse over coming weeks -- according to the World Health Organization (WHO).

item.title: Biden calls Cuba a 'failed state' and communism 'a universally failed system'
item.description: President Joe Biden said on Thursday that Cuba is a "failed state" and called communism a "failed system" as protests play out against the Caribbean nation's repressive regime.

item.title: 2 bodies found in the former Versace mansion
item.description: Two men were found dead inside a hotel room at the former Gianni Versace mansion in Miami Beach on Wednesday afternoon, police said.

item.title: 'You f**king did this': Liz Cheney rips Jim Jordan after Capitol riot
item.description: A new book details a phone call between Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WI) and Gen. Mark Milley the day after the Capitol insurrection, in which Cheney told Milley what she experienced on the House floor on January 6, including a run-in with Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), a staunch Trump ally in the House who feverishly tried to overturn the election.

item.title: Lebanon's Hariri steps down as PM-designate, pushing country further into crisis
item.description: Lebanon's Prime Minister-designate Saad Hariri has stepped down nearly nine months after he was tasked with forming the crisis-ridden country's next government.

item.title: Brain implant helps paralyzed man 'speak' using just his thoughts and a computer
item.description: A brain implant has helped restore a type of speech to a man more than 15 years after a stroke robbed him of the ability to speak, researchers reported Wednesday.

item.title: Smithsonian receives biggest gift in museum's history from Jeff Bezos
item.description: The Smithsonian said Thursday that Jeff Bezos will donate $200 million to the museum, the largest gift the institution has received since its founding in 1846.

item.title: Tennessee doctors want investigation into state's handling of pandemic
item.description: CNN's Martin Savidge gives a deeper look at Tennessee's political battle over the handling of coronavirus vaccinations after the state health department temporarily halted all adolescent vaccine outreach, even for vaccines not related to Covid-19.

item.title: Mastercard has been banned from issuing new cards in India
item.description: Mastercard has been ordered to stop taking new customers in India, as authorities there say it violated the country's rules on how data should be stored.

item.title: Amazon rainforest emitting more carbon dioxide than it absorbs in some areas
item.description: Parts of the Amazon rainforest are now emitting more carbon dioxide than they absorb, raising fears of the potentially devastating impact on its fragile ecosystems and a further worsening of the climate crisis, according to a new study.

item.title: Dutch crime journalist Peter R. de Vries dies in hospital
item.description: Dutch crime journalist Peter R. de Vries has died in hospital, according to CNN affiliate RTL News and a statement by his family published by national broadcaster NOS.

item.title: India is bombarding Twitter with user data requests and demands to remove content
item.description: Twitter is under enormous pressure in India this year. But even before the country rolled out strict new rules for tech firms, the company was hit by a wave of requests from the government to remove content or provide user data.

item.title: 'Shocking, but not surprising': George Conway reacts to Trump book excerpt
item.description: Conservative attorney George Conway reacts to an excerpt from a new book that alleges top military official Gen. Mark Milley feared former President Trump would attempt a coup following his 2020 election loss.

item.title: Woman qualifies for US Naval Special Warfare Command crew for first time
item.description: A woman qualified to become a part of the Naval Special Warfare Command crew for the first time in the organization's history, according to a press release from the US Navy Thursday.

item.title: Retired soldier claims 26 Colombians accused in Haiti assassination were actually hired to protect the President
Cocaine disguised as charcoal worth up to $41 million seized by police
item.description: Cocaine disguised as charcoal with an estimated street value of up to 35 million euros ($41.4 million) has been seized in a joint operation between Irish and Dutch authorities.

item.title: Journalist says Iran plotted to kidnap her in the US
item.description: Iranian journalist and activist Masih Alinejad says that she is the person who is targeted by four Iranian nationals that have been charged in an alleged kidnapping plot. A spokesman for Iran's Foreign Minister called the allegation "baseless."

item.title: Djokovic keeps Golden Slam in play with announcement he'll compete in Olympics
item.description: World No. 1 Novak Djokovic announced on social media on Thursday that he will compete in the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Cave house may have been home to an English king
item.description: Archaeologists in England have identified a near-complete Anglo-Saxon cave house, which, they say, may once have been the home of a king who became a saint.

item.title: Abandoned towns offer a glimpse of Qatar's humble past
item.description: Past the small arched door, a narrow spiral stair leads up to the top of the windswept minaret, still standing tall even as almost everything around it has crumbled.

item.title: CNN rolls the tape on Fox News hosts' anti-vaccine rhetoric
item.description: CNN's John Berman and Brianna Keilar show some of the anti-vaccine propaganda viewers of right-wing media are being exposed to.

item.title: The UK has a new $33 billion tech giant
item.description: There's a new super-unicorn in the United Kingdom.

item.title: He lost his home to the Olympics. Twice.
item.description: As the Tokyo Olympics get underway, there are some who are not happy about Japan's investment and others who can't wait. CNN's Will Ripley reports from Tokyo, Japan.

item.title: DeChambeau 'living on the razor's edge' at the Open, but for now his driver 'sucks'
item.description: The crowds slowly grasp who is on the tee box and the whispers intensify.

item.title: These apps are trying to put car dealers out of business
item.description: City dwellers are used to switching between apps to decide the best way to get from A to B. Is it quickest to get the train or the bus? What about a taxi or a city bike? Which provider has the nearest e-scooter?

item.title: NASA begins high-stakes repair to Hubble Space Telescope
item.description: NASA engineers are trying to work their magic on the Hubble Space Telescope, which stopped working on June 13 as a result of a problem with the payload computer on board.

item.title: Airline switches to gender-neutral plane greetings
item.description: German airline group Lufthansa will greet fliers using gender-neutral language from now on.

item.title: Remember when Diana Ross wowed Central Park in glittering jumpsuits?
item.description: They say rain can be a sign of good luck. And it certainly was -- in hindsight, at least -- for Diana Ross when a torrential rainstorm struck during her televised Central Park performance on the evening of July 21, 1983.

item.title: Microsoft is bringing back Clippy
item.description: Clippy hasn't had an easy life. Microsoft's iconic but polarizing virtual assistant first appeared in Windows 97 as a small paper clip to help Microsoft Office users. It was given the boot by Office 2007.

item.title: Man went to the wrong apartment to do cleaning. See what happened
item.description: Louis Angelino went to clean his friend's apartment for extra money. After two hours of hard work, and playing with two cats, he realized he was not in his friend's apartment.

item.title: Chrissy Teigen opens up about depression after becoming part of the 'cancel club'
item.description: Chrissy Teigen is feeling "lost" these days.

item.title: Foo Fighters postpone concert after confirmed Covid-19 case
item.description: Weeks after the Foo Fighters played the first capacity show at Madison Square Garden, they have announced they must postpone their Los Angeles concert due to a confirmed case of Covid-19 within their organization.

item.title: Royal Caribbean is not responsible for toddler's 2019 cruise ship death, judge rules
item.description: Royal Caribbean Cruises is not responsible for the death of an 18-month-old girl who fell from her grandfather's arms through a window on a cruise ship, a judge ruled Tuesday.

item.title: The architectural wonders of Thailand's White Temple
item.description: There are 33,000 traditional temples in Thailand. But with its majestic, otherworldly exterior, Wat Rong Khun is unlike any other site of worship. From the ghoulish heads that hang from surrounding trees, to the hands that reach for you as you cross the bridge to the main temple, every part of this site is unique. While Wat Rong Khun attracts thousands of tourists from around the world, it received negative attention when it first opened because critics said it wasn't traditional Thai art. Yet the temple continues to stand defiantly as a symbol of Thai art for a modern world.

item.title: An 18-year-old is going to space with Jeff Bezos
item.description: The mystery bidder who put up a whopping $28 million for an 11-minute joy ride to the edge of space alongside Jeff Bezos will not make the trip, Bezos' rocket company Blue Origin announced Thursday.

item.title: Lyft is bringing back a version of shared rides
item.description: Shared rides were a key part of how the founders of Uber and Lyft envisioned disrupting transportation. Back in 2014, the companies raced each other to be first to announce their carpooling options, with the promise of creating a more efficient service that's also more affordable for riders.

item.title: In Malaysia, Darth Vader is leading a shadow puppetry revival
item.description: The Force is strong in Tinto Chou. The shadow puppet designer is using "Star Wars" characters like Darth Vader, Princess Leia and Luke Skywalker to get audiences interested in the ancient art of wayang kulit. We visit Chou in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, to see how he and a 13th generation master puppeteer known as Pak Dain are taking delighted audiences to a galaxy far, far away with every epic performance.

item.title: At this museum exhibition, the security guards are the curators
item.description: Museum security officers, the people who probably spend the most time looking at art, will soon be organizing an exhibition at the Baltimore Museum of Art (BMA) as guest curators.

item.title: One of the biggest names in craft beer is hopping over to the cannabis business
item.description: Nearly 20 years ago, a batch of hand-canned beers started a seismic shift in the craft beer industry. Now the man behind that endeavor is turning his attention to hand-cultivated cannabis.

item.title: Bucks rally to defeat Suns, level NBA Finals series at 2-2
item.description: The Milwaukee Bucks rallied from nine points down in the fourth quarter to defeat the Phoenix Suns 109-103 in Game 4 of the NBA Finals on Wednesday to tie the best-of-seven series at 2-2 in front their own elated fans at Fiserv Forum.

item.title: Belgian mayor calls on residents to evacuate as water level continues to rise
How America's top general found himself caught up in Trump's political wars
item.description: • Trump and McCarthy to meet as Jan. 6 hearing looms • Analysis: Trump revelations signal danger

item.title: Head of security at Haiti's presidential residence in police custody
item.description: The head of security at Haiti's presidential residence has been placed in police custody, according to a close associate, as authorities continue to investigate the assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moise.
